Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2011 07:15PM mahometmom62 wrote: Ok here is my story. I am in panic mode!!! 15 months out fro. Diagnosis in right breast. Been thru it all just had implants put in 5 weeks this thursday. My left is my natural but both with silicone implants for bigger bust. Woke up this am with my nipple stinging horrible on my natural side. PS said nothing he did not sure. The pain is minimal now but red nipple along the bottom left. I am freaking out!! Can it be Pagets? Can that just show up over night? I went with out a bra the day before wondered about chaffing too. Any advise
Posts.Title: Pagets in both breasts? Tropix711 mahometmom62

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2011 06:49PM mahometmom62 wrote: We have come to the conclusion its the oil glands one of mine before surgery stuck out but now since implant its way out its better now been putting A&D ointment on it. Hope it toughens up it so sensitive to touch.

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 09:54AM mahometmom62 wrote: Hey girls....  I started using Nioxin shampoo its for people who have thin hair and it helps the hair folicle stay healthy and allow hair to grow, really I think its working really well.... my hair is really thick, and thank god no curls!!   The shampoo makes your hair squeeky clean really it actually squeeks when you rinse...lol

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 09:59AM mahometmom62 wrote: Hi I did not have scans, 1.5cm 1 axilary node grade IIa just finishded treatment with taxol on Jan 24th.  Now on Tamoxifen Doc said scans can be false negative especially the PET scan.  And I know several who had to have like 5 biopsies to rule out what ever showed on the PET scan and they were all negative.  But can you imagine ..... she had a live, lung and kidney biopsie terrible stress and pain....  So for me its really ok for him not too do them, but still in the back of my mind I wonder if I should.... Its all a part of the journey
